quote: You know, the period of World War I and the Roaring Twenties were really just about the same as today. You worked, and you made a living if you could, and you tired to make the best of things. For an actor or a dancer, it was no different then than today. It was a struggle.
author: James Cagney

quote: Preemption is the right of any nation in order to preserve its National Security; however, preemptive war is a tactic, not a strategy. When used as a strategy preemption dilutes diplomacy, creates an atmosphere of distrust, and promotes regional instability.
author: Ellen Tauscher

quote: An empire founded by war has to maintain itself by war.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: It is my conviction that killing under the cloak of war is nothing but an act of murder.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: In modern war... you will die like a dog for no good reason.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: In war, you win or lose, live or die - and the difference is just an eyelash.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: War against a foreign country only happens when the moneyed classes think they are going to profit from it.
author: George Orwell

quote: War is a defeat for humanity.
author: Pope John Paul II

quote: All warfare is based on deception.
author: Unknown

quote: The very essence of literature is the war between emotion and intellect, between life and death. When literature becomes too intellectual - when it begins to ignore the passions, the emotions - it becomes sterile, silly, and actually without substance.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Let us wage a moral and political war against the billionaires and corporate leaders, on Wall Street and elsewhere, whose policies and greed are destroying the middle class of America.
author: Bernie Sanders

quote: The war on drugs is wrong, both tactically and morally. It assumes that people are too stupid, too reckless, and too irresponsible to decide whether and under what conditions to consume drugs. The war on drugs is morally bankrupt.
author: Larry Elder

quote: Classical tragedy was the war between good and evil. We wanted evil to be defeated and good to be victorious. But the battle in modern tragedy is between good and good. And no matter which side wins, we'll still be heartbroken.
author: Asghar Farhadi

quote: War should never be entered upon until every agency of peace has failed.
author: William McKinley

quote: America has fought five wars since 1945 and has gained its objectives in only one of them, the Gulf War.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: Diplomats are just as essential to starting a war as soldiers are for finishing it... You take diplomacy out of war, and the thing would fall flat in a week.
author: Will Rogers

quote: A hospital alone shows what war is.
author: Erich Maria Remarque

quote: Thus they have an idol that they petition for victory in war; another for success in their labors; and so for everything in which they seek or desire prosperity, they have their idols, which they honor and serve.
author: Hernan Cortes

quote: I shall proceed from the simple to the complex. But in war more than in any other subject we must begin by looking at the nature of the whole for here more than elsewhere the part and the whole must always be thought of together.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

quote: We used to wonder where war lived, what it was that made it so vile. And now we realize that we know where it lives... inside ourselves.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The idea that a war can be won by standing on the defensive and waiting for the enemy to attack is a dangerous fallacy, which owes its inception to the desire to evade the price of victory.
author: Douglas Haig

quote: The War on Drugs employs millions - politicians, bureaucrats, policemen, and now the military - that probably couldn't find a place for their dubious talents in a free market, unless they were to sell pencils from a tin cup on street corners.
author: L. Neil Smith

quote: The threat today is not that of the 1930s. It's not big powers going to war with each other. The ravages which fundamentalist political ideology inflicted on the 20th century are memories. The Cold war is over. Europe is at peace, if not always diplomatically.
author: Tony Blair

quote: My father wanted to be a hero. He went to the Air Force Academy, was valedictorian, and then he found himself strafing villagers in Vietnam in a war he didn't want to be in and didn't understand. He was extremely conflicted about the line where he went from being the good guy to possibly being the bad guy.
author: Patty Jenkins

quote: In most communities it is illegal to cry 'fire' in a crowded assembly. Should it not be considered serious international misconduct to manufacture a general war scare in an effort to achieve local political aims?
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: War is so unjust and ugly that all who wage it must try to stifle the voice of conscience within themselves.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: War is to man what maternity is to a woman. From a philosophical and doctrinal viewpoint, I do not believe in perpetual peace.
author: Benito Mussolini

quote: Be polite write diplomatically even in a declaration of war one observes the rules of politeness.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: To all those who walk the path of human cooperation war must appear loathsome and inhuman.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: The sinews of war are infinite money.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: If there is no sufficient reason for war, the war party will make war on one pretext, then invent another... after the war is on.
author: Robert M. La Follette

quote: How is it they live in such harmony the billions of stars - when most men can barely go a minute without declaring war in their minds about someone they know.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: People always make war when they say they love peace.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Killing Japanese didn't bother me very much at that time... I suppose if I had lost the war, I would have been tried as a war criminal.
author: Curtis LeMay

quote: Although our war on drugs must be fortified with the best laws, enforcement efforts and resources, we would not be successful without your individual commitment to this cause.
author: Mel Carnahan

quote: May the same Almighty Goodness banish the accursed monster, war, from all lands, with her hated associates, rapine and insatiable ambition!
author: Daniel Boone

quote: In this first testing ground of the atomic bomb I have seen the most terrible and frightening desolation in four years of war. It makes a blitzed Pacific island seem like an Eden. The damage is far greater than photographs can show.
author: Wilfred Burchett

quote: War is failure of diplomacy.
author: John Dingell

quote: President Johnson did not want the Vietnam War to broaden. He wanted the North Vietnamese to leave their brothers in the South alone.
author: William Westmoreland

quote: Weapons are an important factor in war, but not the decisive one; it is man and not materials that counts.
author: Mao Zedong

quote: The grim fact is that we prepare for war like precocious giants, and for peace like retarded pygmies.
author: Lester B. Pearson

quote: In the practical art of war, the best thing of all is to take the enemy's country whole and intact; to shatter and destroy it is not so good.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: And we love to dance, especially that new one called the Civil War Twist. The Northern part of you stands still while the Southern part tries to secede.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: Today we know that World War II began not in 1939 or 1941 but in the 1920's and 1930's when those who should have known better persuaded themselves that they were not their brother's keeper.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: I'm finding myself really angry over spending and the deficit. I'm finding myself really angry over what's happening in the Middle East, the decision to stay in Afghanistan indefinitely. I'm angry about cap and trade. And I've been on record for a long time on the failed war on drugs.
author: Gary Johnson

quote: I grew up on what everybody called a plantation - but believe me, it wasn't a plantation. It was just an old farm. I grew up with a lot of black people working in the fields, and it was during the Depression between 1930 and the war, so we were all poor - black and white.
author: Sam Phillips

quote: I've always been at war with myself, for right or wrong.
author: Brad Pitt

quote: War is hell. Hollywood fantasizes about it and makes it look good... war sucks.
author: Chris Kyle

quote: I'm trying to raise the awareness of the troops that, when they deploy and go to war, it's not just them at war - it's also their family. Their family is having to go through all the hardships and the stresses.
author: Chris Kyle

quote: When the peace treaty is signed, the war isn't over for the veterans, or the family. It's just starting.
author: Karl Marlantes

quote: One of the greatest casualties of the war in Vietnam is the Great Society... shot down on the battlefield of Vietnam.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: War is God's way of teaching Americans geography.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Americans play to win at all times. I wouldn't give a hoot and hell for a man who lost and laughed. That's why Americans have never lost nor ever lose a war.
author: George S. Patton

quote: The U.S. army confirmed that it gave a lucrative fire fighting contract in Iraq to the firm once run by the Vice President Dick Cheney without any competitive bidding. When asked if this could be conceived as Cheney's friends profiting from the war, the spokesman said 'Yes.'
author: Conan O'Brien

quote: As history since Hiroshima shows, the best, perhaps the only, way to curb war is to deter it with such overwhelming force as to turn it from a struggle into suicide.
author: Martin Van Creveld

quote: My home policy: I wage war my foreign policy: I wage war. All the time I wage war.
author: Georges Clemenceau

quote: I always found the extraordinary loss of life in the First World War very moving. I remember learning about it as a very young child, as an eight- or nine-year-old, asking my teachers what poppies were for. Every year the teachers would suddenly wear these red paper flowers in their lapels, and I would say 'What does that mean?'
author: Tom Hiddleston

quote: Wanton killing of innocent civilians is terrorism, not a war against terrorism.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: War is a racket. It always has been... A few profit - and the many pay. But there is a way to stop it. You can't end it by disarmament conferences. You can't eliminate it by peace parleys at Geneva. Well-meaning but impractical groups can't wipe it out by resolutions. It can be smashed effectively only by taking the profit out of war.
author: Smedley Butler

quote: 'But,' say the puling, pusillanimous cowards, 'we shall be subject to a long and bloody war if we declare independence.' On the contrary, I affirm it the only step that can bring the contest to a speedy and happy issue.
author: Samuel Adams

quote: A nation's ability to fight a modern war is as good as its technological ability.
author: Frank Whittle

quote: The peasant must always be helped technically, economically, morally and culturally. The guerrilla fighter will be a sort of guiding angel who has fallen into the zone, helping the poor always and bothering the rich as little as possible in the first phases of the war.
author: Che Guevara

quote: Study and work and work and study will keep in active exercise both the physical and mental. These two, rightly conducted, will not war against each other.
author: Ellen G. White

quote: Serious sport is war minus the shooting.
author: George Orwell

quote: War is wrong. Conscription for war is inconsistent with freedom of conscience, which is not merely the right to believe but to act on the degree of truth that one receives, to follow a vocation which is God-inspired and God-directed.
author: Bayard Rustin

quote: The lesson of the Cuban Missile Crisis is plain: Strength prevents war weakness invites it. We need a commander-in-chief who understands that - and who won't leave us facing a foe who thinks he doesn't.
author: Arthur L. Herman

quote: In wartime, truth is so precious that she should always be attended by a bodyguard of lies.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: When the women's liberation movement began, when people began protesting against the Vietnam War, civil rights movement, at the beginning of those movements, the majority of the country was not with them, did not believe in the basic principles of any of those philosophies.
author: Michael Moore

quote: In the first six to twelve months of a war with the United States and Great Britain I will run wild and win victory upon victory. But then, if the war continues after that, I have no expectation of success.
author: Isoroku Yamamoto

quote: Our life is half natural and half technological. Half-and-half is good. You cannot deny that high-tech is progress. We need it for jobs. Yet if you make only high-tech, you make war. So we must have a strong human element to keep modesty and natural life.
author: Nam June Paik

quote: Wars are not paid for in wartime, the bill comes later.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Those who are at war with others are not at peace with themselves.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: During the Cold War, America undertook serious military cuts only once: after the election of Richard Nixon, during the Vietnam War. The result: Vietnam fell to the Communists, the Russians moved into Afghanistan, and American influence around the globe waned dramatically.
author: Ben Shapiro

quote: The mother's battle for her child with sickness, with poverty, with war, with all the forces of exploitation and callousness that cheapen human life needs to become a common human battle, waged in love and in the passion for survival.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Speaking as a writer, it would be difficult to find an event in American history more dramatic and riveting than the Civil War.
author: David Zabel

quote: During World War II, law-abiding Japanese-American citizens were herded into remote internment camps, losing their jobs, businesses and social standing, while an all-Japanese-American division fought heroically in Europe.
author: Tom Brokaw

quote: Don't settle; don't compromise. Freeze your eggs, get your sociology doctorate, worry more about war and pestilence and the incredible inequality of geographical birth than finding your soulmate.
author: Nia Vardalos

quote: The sacrifices in the war against terrorism reflect complete and strong determination of Pakistan against terrorism.
author: Shehbaz Sharif

quote: In some states militant nationalism has gone to the lengths of dictatorship, the cult of the absolute or totalitarian state and the glorification of war.
author: Arthur Henderson

quote: Today continuing poverty and distress are a deeper and more important cause of international tensions, of the conditions that can produce war, than previously.
author: Lester B. Pearson

quote: I have known war as few men now living know it. It's very destructiveness on both friend and foe has rendered it useless as a means of settling international disputes.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: The United States is not, and never will be, at war with Islam.
author: Barack Obama

quote: My husband was in the war of the Crimea. It is terrible the hardships he went through, to be two months without going into a house, under the snow in trenches. And no food to get, maybe a biscuit in the day. And there was enough food there, he said, to feed all Ireland; but bad management, they could not get it.
author: Lady Gregory

quote: Anyone who experienced World War I close-hand was grossed out by it forever. It just was so awful.
author: Amity Shlaes

quote: If... many influential people have failed to understand, or have just forgotten, what we were up against in the Cold War and how we overcame it, they are not going to be capable of securing, let alone enlarging, the gains that liberty has made.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: There was never a good war, or a bad peace.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: My subject is War, and the pity of War. The Poetry is in the pity.
author: Wilfred Owen

quote: My mom, Irmelin, taught me the value of life. Her own life was saved by my grandmother during World War II.
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

quote: A state of war only serves as an excuse for domestic tyranny.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Patriots always talk of dying for their country and never of killing for their country.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Sometime they'll give a war and nobody will come.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: All wars are civil wars, because all men are brothers.
author: Francois Fenelon

quote: The way to win an atomic war is to make certain it never starts.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: Wars can be prevented just as surely as they can be provoked, and we who fail to prevent them, must share the guilt for the dead.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: It is not patriotic to commit young Americans to war unless our national security clearly requires it.
author: George McGovern

quote: To walk through the ruined cities of Germany is to feel an actual doubt about the continuity of civilization.
author: George Orwell

quote: When the rich wage war, it's the poor who die.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: War will exist until that distant day when the conscientious objector enjoys the same reputation and prestige that the warrior does today.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: War remains the decisive human failure.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: We must concentrate not merely on the negative expulsion of war but the postive affirmation of peace.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: An army marches on its stomach.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: It is well that war is so terrible, otherwise we should grow too fond of it.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: The war... was an unnecessary condition of affairs, and might have been avoided if forebearance and wisdom had been practiced on both sides.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Wars have never hurt anybody except the people who die.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: There will one day spring from the brain of science a machine or force so fearful in its potentialities, so absolutely terrifying, that even man, the fighter, who will dare torture and death in order to inflict torture and death, will be appalled, and so abandon war forever.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: The most successful war seldom pays for its losses.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: It is forbidden to kill therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
author: Voltaire

quote: A lasting order cannot be established by bayonets.
author: Ludwig von Mises

quote: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: We should seek by all means in our power to avoid war, by analysing possible causes, by trying to remove them, by discussion in a spirit of collaboration and good will.
author: Neville Chamberlain

quote: I do not believe that civilization will be wiped out in a war fought with the atomic bomb. Perhaps two-thirds of the people of the earth will be killed.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: When antibiotics became industrially produced following World War II, our quality of life and our longevity improved enormously. No one thought bacteria were going to become resistant.
author: Bonnie Bassler

quote: The real and lasting victories are those of peace, and not of war.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: People were already beginning to forget, what horrible suffering the war had brought them. I did not want to cause fear and panic, but to let people know how dreadful war is and so to stimulate people's powers of resistance.
author: Otto Dix

quote: I was one of those children forced into fighting at the age of 13, in my country Sierra Leone, a war that claimed the lives of my mother, father and two brothers. I know too well the emotional, psychological and physical burden that comes with being exposed to violence as a child or at any age for that matter.
author: Ishmael Beah

quote: It is the function of the Navy to carry the war to the enemy so that it is not fought on U.S. soil.
author: Chester W. Nimitz

quote: From infancy, I had been accustomed to hear pro and con discussions of slavery and the American Civil War. Although the British government finally decided not to recognise the Confederacy, public opinion in England was sharply divided on the questions both of slavery and of secession.
author: Emmeline Pankhurst

quote: When I was a young boy, during the aftermath of World War II, Germany was broken and in ruins. Many people were hungry, sick, and dying. I remember well the humanitarian shipments of food and clothing that came from the Church in Salt Lake City.
author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

quote: Peace is not an absence of war, it is a virtue, a state of mind, a disposition for benevolence, confidence, justice.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: We prefer world law in the age of self-determination to world war in the age of mass extermination.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If men make war in slavish obedience to rules, they will fail.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: The war against terrorism is terrorism.
author: Woody Harrelson

quote: War makes strange giant creatures out of us little routine men who inhabit the earth.
author: Ernie Pyle

quote: War alone brings up to their highest tension all human energies and imposes the stamp of nobility upon the peoples who have the courage to make it.
author: Benito Mussolini

quote: The quickest way of ending a war is to lose it.
author: George Orwell

quote: Ronald Reagan will be remembered for leading the United States during a time of tremendous international transition - the demise of the Soviet Union, the Berlin Wall coming down, and the end of the Cold War.
author: Mary Landrieu

quote: Peace is the virtue of civilization. War is its crime.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: In remembering the appalling suffering of war on both sides, we recognise how precious is the peace we have built in Europe since 1945.
author: Queen Elizabeth II

quote: War is too serious a matter to leave to soldiers.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: I may not lead the most dramatic life, but in my brain it's 'War and Peace' everyday.
author: Rufus Wainwright

quote: The Patriot Act is essential to our continued success in the war on terror here at home.
author: Mike Pence

quote: In every war zone that I've been in, there has been a reality and then there has been the public perception of why the war was being fought. In every crisis, the issues have been far more complex than the public has been allowed to know.
author: John le Carre

quote: I extend my deepest gratitude to our Armed Forces and first responders serving both at home and abroad in the war against terrorism.
author: John Doolittle

quote: When we analyze this war in a materialistic way and ask when is it going to end and who will be the winner and the loser, it means that we do not see the endgame.
author: Bashar al-Assad

quote: Yes, politics IS war without bloodshed; and war is an extension of those politics.
author: H. Rap Brown

quote: Developments in information technology and globalised media mean that the most powerful military in the history of the world can lose a war, not on the battlefield of dust and blood, but on the battlefield of world opinion.
author: Timothy Garton Ash

quote: It's an interesting combination: Having a great fear of being alone, and having a desperate need for solitude and the solitary experience. That's always been a tug of war for me.
author: Jodie Foster

quote: War is a blessing compared with national degradation.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: We've used up a lot of bullets. And we talk about stimulus. But the truth is, we're running a federal deficit that's 9 percent of GDP. That is stimulative as all get out. It's more stimulative than any policy we've followed since World War II.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: When I was a youngster growing up in South Dakota, we never referred to the national debt, it was always referred to as the war debt because it stemmed from World War I.
author: George McGovern

quote: Past records of inter-Korean relations show that confrontation between fellow countrymen leads to nothing but war.
author: Kim Jong-un

quote: When I was a young man, I was poor. In a war with other nations, I was in eighty-seven fights. There I received my name and was made Chief of my nation. But now I am old and am for peace.
author: Red Cloud

quote: Almost everything about American society is affected by World War II: our feelings about race; our feelings about gender and the empowerment of women, moving women into the workplace; our feelings about our role in the world. All of that comes in a very direct way out of World War II.
author: Rick Atkinson

quote: The earth is bountiful, and where her bounty fails, nitrogen drawn from the air will refertilize her womb. I developed a process for this purpose in 1900. It was perfected fourteen years later under the stress of war by German chemists.
author: Nikola Tesla

quote: I have a graduate degree from Penn State. I studied at Penn State under a noted Hemingway scholar, Philip Young. I had an interest in thrillers, and it occurred to me that Hemingway wrote many action scenes: the war scenes in 'A Farewell to Arms' and 'For Whom the Bell Tolls' come to mind. But the scenes don't feel pulpy.
author: David Morrell

quote: As a Korean War veteran, I know firsthand and understand the sacrifices made by our men and women in uniform.
author: Charles B. Rangel

quote: It's my belief that, since the end of the Second World War, psychology has moved too far away from its original roots, which were to make the lives of all people more fulfilling and productive, and too much toward the important, but not all-important, area of curing mental illness.
author: Martin Seligman

quote: The Korean War, which China entered on the side of North Korea, fixed Mao's image in the United States as another unappeasable Communist.
author: Pankaj Mishra

quote: When we contend, let us contend for all our rights - the doubtful and the certain, the unimportant and essential. It is as easy to contend, or even more so, for the whole as for a part. At the termination of the contest, secure all that our wisdom and valour and the fortune of war will permit.
author: John C. Calhoun

quote: The only thing that kept the Cold War cold was the mutual deterrence afforded by nuclear weapons.
author: Chung Mong-joon

quote: Syria is attracting a lot more Westerners than the Iraq War ever did because it's the perfect Sunni jihad.
author: Peter L. Bergen

quote: The most important accomplishment, I believe, was my voting against the First World War.
author: Jeannette Rankin

quote: We believe in peace in the settlement of all disputes through peaceful means, in the abolition of war, and, more particularly, nuclear war.
author: Lal Bahadur Shastri

quote: World War II was the last government program that really worked.
author: George Will

quote: I've been to war, and it's not easy to kill. It's bloody and messy and totally horrifying, and the consequences are serious.
author: Oliver Stone

quote: A prisoner of war is a man who tries to kill you and fails, and then asks you not to kill him.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I used to think that the Civil War was our country's greatest tragedy, but I do remember that there were some redeeming features in the Civil War in that there was some spirit of sacrifice and heroism displayed on both sides. I see no redeeming features in Watergate.
author: Sam Ervin

quote: Our strategy is one of preventing war by making it self-evident to our enemies that they're going to get their clocks cleaned if they start one.
author: John W. Vessey, Jr.

quote: The Vietnam War required us to emphasize the national interest rather than abstract principles. What President Nixon and I tried to do was unnatural. And that is why we didn't make it.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: We have always said that in our war with the Arabs we had a secret weapon - no alternative.
author: Golda Meir

quote: War is an instrument entirely inefficient toward redressing wrong; and multiplies, instead of indemnifying losses.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Lots of people who complained about us receiving the MBE received theirs for heroism in the war - for killing people. We received ours for entertaining other people. I'd say we deserve ours more.
author: John Lennon

quote: I took a speed-reading course and read War and Peace in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
author: Woody Allen

quote: A time will come when a politician who has willfully made war and promoted international dissension will be as sure of the dock and much surer of the noose than a private homicide. It is not reasonable that those who gamble with men's lives should not stake their own.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: In war there is no substitute for victory.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: Peace is the happy natural state of man war is corruption and disgrace.
author: James Thomson

quote: Mankind will never win lasting peace so long as men use their full resources only in tasks of war. While we are yet at peace, let us mobilize the potentialities, particularly the moral and spiritual potentialities, which we usually reserve for war.
author: John Foster Dulles

quote: Many intelligence reports in war are contradictory; even more are false, and most are uncertain.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

quote: War should be the only study of a prince. He should consider peace only as a breathing-time, which gives him leisure to contrive, and furnishes as ability to execute, military plans.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Television brought the brutality of war into the comfort of the living room. Vietnam was lost in the living rooms of America - not on the battlefields of Vietnam.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: If we lose the war in the air we lose the war and we lose it quickly.
author: Bernard Law Montgomery

quote: If you want to go anywhere in modern war, in the air, on the sea, on the land, you must have command of the air.
author: William Halsey

quote: In time of peace prepare for war.
author: Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus

quote: One can go to war alone, but you can't build peace alone.
author: Jacques Chirac

quote: All oppression creates a state of war.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: All the gods are dead except the god of war.
author: Eldridge Cleaver

quote: As for charity, it is a matter in which the immediate effect on the persons directly concerned, and the ultimate consequence to the general good, are apt to be at complete war with one another.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Only the most deluded of us could doubt the necessity of this war.
author: John McCain

quote: Running for President is physically, emotionally, mentally and spiritually the most demanding single undertaking I can envisage unless it's World War III.
author: Walter F. Mondale

quote: The first lesson is that you can't lose a war if you have command of the air, and you can't win a war if you haven't.
author: Jimmy Doolittle

quote: We live in the time where we have fictitious election results that elects a fictitious president. We live in a time where we have a man sending us to war for fictitious reasons.
author: Michael Moore

quote: No war is inevitable until it breaks out.
author: A. J. P. Taylor

quote: Our modern states are preparing for war without even knowing the future enemy.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: It is part of the general pattern of misguided policy that our country is now geared to an arms economy which was bred in an artificially induced psychosis of war hysteria and nurtured upon an incessant propaganda of fear.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: When people speak to you about a preventive war, you tell them to go and fight it. After my experience, I have come to hate war.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: The essential act of war is destruction, not necessarily of human lives, but of the products of human labor.
author: George Orwell

quote: War is not an independent phenomenon, but the continuation of politics by different means.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

quote: It is the youth who must inherit the tribulation, the sorrow... that are the aftermath of war.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: If our most highly qualified General Staff officers had been told to work out the most nonsensical high level organization for war which they could think of, they could not have produced anything more stupid that that which we have at present.
author: Claus von Stauffenberg

quote: Sometimes I think war is God's way of teaching us geography.
author: Paul Rodriguez

quote: War is the remedy that our enemies have chosen, and I say let us give them all they want.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: You cannot qualify war in harsher terms than I will.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: So, this war is against the Islam that the West does not control.
author: Louis Farrakhan

quote: In a world of inhumanity, war and terrorism, American citizenship is a very precious possession.
author: Phyllis Schlafly

quote: When was the last time you saw a musical about people at war with each other?
author: Rita Moreno

quote: You can say battle or war or whatever, but in the end, it's music. It's not really violent in intent at all, it's really just about expression and celebrating that in itself.
author: Eric San

quote: Every soldier thinks something of the moral aspects of what he is doing. But all war is immoral and if you let that bother you, you're not a good soldier.
author: Curtis LeMay

quote: As soon as I read that, it clicked: that's my theater of war. It was exciting to think that I could write about World War Two from a totally new place.
author: Michael Chabon

quote: It's a war of attrition. If you have patience and a modicum of faith in yourself your chances are not too bad.
author: Julie Bowen

quote: If something is said about the Raiders, I'm ready to go to war.
author: Jim Otto

quote: No one will deny that the excessive use of alcohol and alcoholic beverages would do more than any other single factor to make impossible a total war effort.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

quote: Nevertheless, China was unfortunately unable to understand Japan's real position, and it is greatly to be regretted that the Sino-Japanese War became one of long duration.
author: Hideki Tojo

quote: As a result of the World War, this old Germany collapsed. It collapsed in its constitution, in its social order, in its economic structure. Its thinking and feeling changed.
author: Gustav Stresemann

quote: If the Founding Fathers and other patriots who fought during the Revolutionary War could see the United States today, I believe they would be proud of the path that the thirteen colonies, now fifty strong states, have taken since then.
author: John Linder

quote: In a war, you must hate somebody or love somebody; you must have a position or you cannot stand what goes on.
author: Robert Capa

quote: Look at what President Kennedy managed to achieve during the Cuban missile crisis. If Bush had been president in 1962, do you think he would have avoided a nuclear war?
author: Bianca Jagger

quote: If there ever was a religious war full of terror, it was the crusades. But you can't blame Christianity because a few adventurers did this. That's my message.
author: Moustapha Akkad

quote: People always seem to assume that we have a full, back-up support team - make-up, costume and a driver - but usually, in a war zone, there's only me and the cameraman.
author: Kate Adie

quote: War is not the answer, because only love can conquer hate.
author: Marvin Gaye

quote: It's the first war we've ever fought on the television screen and the first war that our country ever fought where the media had full reign.
author: William Westmoreland

quote: Bush's war in Iraq has done untold damage to the United States. It has impaired our military power and undermined the morale of our armed forces. Our troops were trained to project overwhelming power. They were not trained for occupation duties.
author: George Soros

quote: Where the stakes are the highest, in the war on terror, we cannot possibly succeed without extraordinary international cooperation. Effective international police actions require the highest degree of intelligence sharing, planning and collaborative enforcement.
author: Barack Obama

quote: There have been only 268 of the past 3,421 years free of war.
author: Will Durant

quote: Everything in war is very simple. But the simplest thing is difficult.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

quote: There are two things which a democratic people will always find very difficult - to begin a war and to end it.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: If few can stand a long war without deterioration of soul, none can stand a long peace.
author: Oswald Spengler

quote: Happiness is a byproduct of function, purpose, and conflict; those who seek happiness for itself seek victory without war.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Be convinced that to be happy means to be free and that to be free means to be brave. Therefore do not take lightly the perils of war.
author: Thucydides

quote: I can not believe that war is the best solution. No one won the last war, and no one will win the next war.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: War is the trade of Kings.
author: John Dryden

quote: Monarchs ought to put to death the authors and instigators of war, as their sworn enemies and as dangers to their states.
author: Elizabeth I

quote: Here's how I think of my money - as soldiers - I send them out to war everyday. I want them to take prisoners and come home, so there's more of them.
author: Kevin O'Leary

quote: My father was an immigrant who literally walked across Europe to get out of Russia. He fought in World War I. He was wounded in action. My father was a great success even though he never had money. He was a very determined man, a great role model.
author: Arlen Specter

quote: I'm old enough to remember the end of World War II. On Aug. 14, 1946, a year after the Japanese were defeated, most newspapers and magazines had single articles commemorating the end of the war.
author: Harry Browne

quote: Unfortunately, in war, there are casualties, including among the civilian population.
author: John O. Brennan

quote: The United States established itself as a trustworthy new nation in its first two decades after the Revolutionary War by paying its debts, even when many in the country believed it had no obligation to do so. Alexander Hamilton, the founder of this newspaper, insisted on it.
author: John Podhoretz

quote: I absolutely don't think a sentient artificial intelligence is going to wage war against the human species.
author: Daniel H. Wilson

quote: 'Matterhorn' is my metaphor of the Vietnam War - we built it, we abandoned it, we assaulted it, we lost, and then we abandoned it again.
author: Karl Marlantes

quote: 'Jihad' can mean holy war to extremists, but it means struggle to the average Muslim.
author: Feisal Abdul Rauf

quote: There is nothing glamorous or romantic about war. It's mostly about random pointless death and misery.
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: In the business of war, the role of women is really to maintain normalcy and ensure that there is cultural continuity.
author: Lynn Nottage

quote: In the name of the rule of law, democracy and human rights, we cannot accept that the rights of individuals (Arab or Muslim) be trampled upon, or that populations are targeted and discriminated against in the name of the war against terrorism.
author: Tariq Ramadan

quote: I preferred the weapons of dialectic to all the other teachings of philosophy, and armed with these, I chose the conflicts of disputation rather than the trophies of war.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: With one terrible exception, the Civil War, law and the Constitution have kept America whole and free.
author: Anthony Lewis

quote: In Iraq, many of my female friends were architects and professionals with a lot of power during the 1980s while all the men were at war in Iran.
author: Zaha Hadid

quote: War is just a racket. A racket is best described, I believe, as something that is not what it seems to the majority of people. Only a small inside group knows what it is about. It is conducted for the benefit of the very few at the expense of the masses.
author: Smedley Butler

quote: War is a form of really bad manners, in a strange way. Invading a country I think is just the worst possible manners. 'You're not invited!' Gate crashing on a large scale!
author: Graydon Carter

quote: The European wars of religion were more deadly than the First World War, proportionally speaking, and in the range of the Second World War in Europe. The Inquisition, the persecution of heretics and infidels and witches, they racked up pretty high death tolls.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: I believe that democracies do not go to war; that's the lesson of history, and I think that a democratic Pakistan is the world community's best guarantee of stability in Asia.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: We all want a world without war, without conflict, without human suffering.
author: Jeremy Gilley

quote: One culture I find fascinating to juxtapose against American culture is the culture of Germany. They've gone through a long process through their art, poetry, public discourse, their politics, of owning the fact of their complicity in what happened in World War II. It's still a topic of everyday conversation in Germany.
author: Chris Jordan

quote: Laws are the terms by which independent and isolated men united to form a society, once they tired of living in a perpetual state of war where the enjoyment of liberty was rendered useless by the uncertainty of its preservation. They sacrificed a portion of this liberty so that they could enjoy the remainder in security and peace.
author: Cesare Beccaria

quote: The Iraq War was the biggest issue for people of my generation in the West. It was also the clearest case, in my living memory, of media manipulation and the creation of a war through ignorance.
author: Julian Assange

quote: The Vietnam War totally turned my life around. Some people's lives were eliminated or destroyed by the experience. I was one of the fortunate few who came out better off.
author: Craig Venter

quote: The world will never have lasting peace so long as men reserve for war the finest human qualities. Peace, no less than war, requires idealism and self-sacrifice and a righteous and dynamic faith.
author: John Foster Dulles

quote: War has become a luxury that only small nations can afford.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Those who can win a war well can rarely make a good peace and those who could make a good peace would never have won the war.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: There have been two popular subjects for poetry in the last few decades: the Vietnam War and AIDS, about both of which almost all of us have felt deeply.
author: Thom Gunn

quote: The real war is not between the West and the East. The real war is between intelligent and stupid people.
author: Marjane Satrapi

quote: If there is not the war, you don't get the great general; if there is not a great occasion, you don't get a great statesman; if Lincoln had lived in a time of peace, no one would have known his name.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: My dear Excellency! I have not gone to war to collect cheese and eggs, but for another purpose.
author: Manfred von Richthofen

quote: Morality is contraband in war.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: We should declare war on North Vietnam. We could pave the whole country and put parking strips on it, and still be home by Christmas.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Sectional football games have the glory and the despair of war, and when a Texas team takes the field against a foreign state, it is an army with banners.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: We know more about war than we know about peace, more about killing than we know about living.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: As to war, I am and always was a great enemy, at the same time a warrior the greater part of my life and were I young again, should still be a warrior while ever this country should be invaded and I lived.
author: Daniel Morgan

quote: War is organized murder and torture against our brothers.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: Democracies are indeed slow to make war, but once embarked upon a martial venture are equally slow to make peace and reluctant to make a tolerable, rather than a vindictive, peace.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Geopolitical drama lessened but did not die after the Cold War; in 2008, the specter of thousands of seeming automatons banging drums at the opening of the Beijing Games frightened and enthralled the world, reminding us that China was a nation on the rise, a competitor for global dominance.
author: Ben Shapiro

quote: The scenes on this field would have cured anybody of war.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: We must fight for peace bravely as we fought in war.
author: Lal Bahadur Shastri

quote: If we don't end war, war will end us.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Ants are so much like human beings as to be an embarrassment. They farm fungi, raise aphids as livestock, launch armies into war, use chemical sprays to alarm and confuse enemies, capture slaves, engage in child labour, exchange information ceaselessly. They do everything but watch television.
author: Lewis Thomas

quote: Construction of the first gas pipeline system was started during the 1960s, at the height of the Cold War, and for all those years, from the 1960s until this day, Russia has been fulfilling its contract obligations in a very consistent and reliable way, regardless of the political situation.
author: Vladimir Putin

quote: In Britain and Europe, no event is less forgotten than World War I, or 'The Great War,' as it was called until 1939.
author: Michael Korda

quote: In nuclear war all men are cremated equal.
author: Dexter Gordon

quote: The leaders of the world face no greater task than that of avoiding nuclear war. While preserving the cause of freedom, we must seek abolition of war through programs of general and complete disarmament. The Test-Ban Treaty of 1963 represents a significant beginning in this immense undertaking.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Haiti and the Dominican Republic don't just share an island, Hispaniola, but a history, one that includes all the signal events that went into creating the modern world: Columbus, conquest, genocide, slavery, imperial war, revolution, and U.S. counterinsurgencies and military occupations.
author: Greg Grandin

quote: Those who remember Washington's cold war culture in the 1980s will recall the shocked reactions to Reagan's intervention. People interested in foreign policy were astonished when in 1985 he met alone at Geneva - alone, not a single strategic thinker at his elbow! - with the Soviet Communist master Gorbachev.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Once brave politicians and others explain the war on drugs' true cost, the American people will scream for a cease-fire. Bring the troops home, people will urge. Treat drugs as a health problem, not as a matter for the criminal justice system.
author: Larry Elder

quote: War consisteth not in battle only, or the act of fighting; but in a tract of time, wherein the will to contend by battle is sufficiently known.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: I'm not going to say I was opposed to the Vietnam War. I'm going to say I'm opposed to war. But I'm also opposed to protests that deny other people their rights.
author: John Wooden

quote: If the people raise a great howl against my barbarity and cruelty, I will answer that war is war, and not popularity seeking.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: Circumstances cause us to act the way we do. We should always bear this in mind before judging the actions of others. I realized this from the start during World War II.
author: Thor Heyerdahl

quote: Capitalism is war socialism is peace.
author: Karl Liebknecht

quote: To secure peace is to prepare for war.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

quote: What shall I say further? Shall I not stop short and leave to your imaginations to portray the tragic deeds of war? Is it not enough that I here leave it even to unexperience to fancy the hardships, the anxieties, the dangers, even of the best life of a soldier?
author: Deborah Sampson

quote: We know we must win the war on terror to protect innocent people and the freedoms that define our way of life.
author: Doc Hastings

quote: Who do you call a civilian in a guerilla war? I mean, it might be a farmer by day or a merchant, a housewife, and by night the housewife may be helping to make landmines and booby traps and who knows.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: Obviously, the greater the length of a war the higher is likely to be the number of casualties in it on either side.
author: Douglas Haig

quote: I know that military alliances and armament have been the reliance for peace for centuries, but they do not produce peace; and when war comes, as it inevitably does under such conditions, these armaments and alliances but intensify and broaden the conflict.
author: Frank B. Kellogg

quote: By the end of World War II, we were the most powerful and least damaged of the great nations. We also had most of the money. America's hegemony lasted exactly five years.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: There is nothing worth having that can be obtained by nuclear war - nothing material or ideological - no tradition that it can defend. It is utterly self-defeating.
author: George Wald

quote: A Failure in this Duty did once involve our Nation in all the Horrors of Rebellion and Civil War.
author: Charles Inglis

quote: As polarized as we have been, we Americans are locked in a cultural war for the soul of our country.
author: Pat Buchanan

quote: There's a War Crimes Act in the United States passed by a Republican Congress in 1996, which says that grave breaches of the Geneva Convention are subject to the death penalty. And that doesn't mean the soldier that committed them - that means the commanders.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The forest restoration campaign is a war to ameliorate nature.
author: Kim Jong-un

quote: The primary, the fundamental, the essential purpose of the United Nations is to keep peace. Everything it does which helps prevent World War III is good. Everything which does not further that goal, either directly or indirectly, is at best superfluous.
author: Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr.

quote: I was the guy who was constantly speaking out against the Vietnam War. I have no regrets about that.
author: George McGovern

quote: The surrealists, and the modern movement in painting as a whole, seemed to offer a key to the strange postwar world with its threat of nuclear war. The dislocations and ambiguities, in cubism and abstract art as well as the surrealists, reminded me of my childhood in Shanghai.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: No matter what political reasons are given for war, the underlying reason is always economic.
author: A. J. P. Taylor

quote: Cyber war takes place largely in secret, unknown to the general public on both sides.
author: Noah Feldman

quote: I think the Cold War works as a great analogy or simile for different kinds of conflict. It's funny, when you look back at it, it's one of the last times that the boundaries were clear. Now, as we see on 'Homeland,' there are no clear boundaries and enemies.
author: Matthew Rhys

quote: I come from - I came from Wales, and it's a strong, butch society. We were in the war and all that. People didn't waste time feeling sorry for themselves. You had to get on with it. So my credo is get on with it. I don't waste time being soft. I'm not cold, but I don't like being, wasting my time with - life's too short.
author: Anthony Hopkins

quote: This war differs from other wars, in this particular. We are not fighting armies but a hostile people, and must make old and young, rich and poor, feel the hard hand of war.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: If you support the war on drugs in its present form, then you're only paying lip-service to the defense of freedom, and you don't really grasp the concept of the sovereign individual human being.
author: Neal Boortz

quote: Once we have a war there is only one thing to do. It must be won. For defeat brings worse things than any that can ever happen in war.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: War: a massacre of people who don't know each other for the profit of people who know each other but don't massacre each other.
author: Paul Valery

quote: This nation has always struggled with how it was going to deal with poor people and people of color. Every few years you will see some great change in the way that they approach this. We've had the war on poverty that never really got into waging a real war on poverty.
author: Maxine Waters

quote: There is many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory, but, boys, it is all hell.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: In all history there is no war which was not hatched by the governments, the governments alone, independent of the interests of the people, to whom war is always pernicious even when successful.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Sometimes people ask me why I began perestroika. Were the causes basically domestic or foreign? The domestic reasons were undoubtedly the main ones, but the danger of nuclear war was so serious that it was a no less significant factor.
author: Mikhail Gorbachev

quote: Migration is the story of my life: my parents and grandparents journeyed across four continents to flee war and find jobs, eventually finding their way to the U.S.
author: Leila Janah

quote: Preparation for war is a constant stimulus to suspicion and ill will.
author: James Monroe

quote: I could have ended the war in a month. I could have made North Vietnam look like a mud puddle.
author: Barry Goldwater

quote: In the World War nothing was more dreadful to witness than a chain of men starting with a battalion commander and ending with an army commander sitting in telephone boxes, improvised or actual, talking, talking, talking, in place of leading, leading, leading.
author: J. F. C. Fuller

quote: Every time we walk along a beach some ancient urge disturbs us so that we find ourselves shedding shoes and garments or scavenging among seaweed and whitened timbers like the homesick refugees of a long war.
author: Loren Eiseley

quote: If we are to assume that North Korea becomes a nuclear-power state, of course the danger of having an all-out nuclear war, that possibility is very slim.
author: Lee Myung-bak

quote: This gulf war syndrome thing is truly unfortunate, and I've met some of the vets who have this. These are my guys, and I feel terrible about it.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: It's kind of a terrible irony, in a way, that the solution to America's problems was World War II.
author: William O'Neill

quote: As a child growing up during the Korean War, I knew poverty. I studied by candlelight.
author: Ban Ki-moon

quote: There are grave misgivings that the discussion on ecology may be designed to distract attention from the problems of war and poverty.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: It was post war. It was very gray, very dreary. Everything was still rationed when I first saw the United States in 1951. I went over to visit my sister who was a war bride.
author: John Mahoney

quote: When it comes to war, we focus more on the mainstream coverage of the event, rather than the event itself. People dying is never funny. Protest puppets are always funny.
author: Mo Rocca

quote: You ask me if I will not be glad when the last battle is fought, so far as the country is concerned I, of course, must wish for peace, and will be glad when the war is ended, but if I answer for myself alone, I must say that I shall regret to see the war end.
author: George Armstrong Custer

quote: But to the fighting soldier that phase of the war is behind. It was left behind after his first battle. His blood is up. He is fighting for his life, and killing now for him is as much a profession as writing is for me.
author: Ernie Pyle

quote: Oceania was at war with Eurasia therefore Oceania had always been at war with Eurasia.
author: George Orwell

quote: We are muddled into war.
author: David Lloyd George

quote: The Berlin Wall wasn't the only barrier to fall after the collapse of the Soviet Union and the end of the Cold War. Traditional barriers to the flow of money, trade, people and ideas also fell.
author: Fareed Zakaria

quote: I was a surf bum wannabe. I left home at age 17 and moved to Southern California to try to take up surfing as a vocation, but this was in 1964, and there was this nasty little thing called the Vietnam War. As a result, I got drafted.
author: Craig Venter

quote: Politics are very much like war. We may even have to use poison gas at times.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: But let there be no misunderstanding. The war against terror is every bit as important as our fight against fascism in World War II. Or our struggle against the spread of Communism during the Cold War.
author: Jim Bunning

quote: Wars are caused by undefended wealth.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: If it were a fact, it wouldn't be called intelligence.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: In times of peace, the war party insists on making preparation for war. As soon as prepared for, it insists on making war.
author: Robert M. La Follette

quote: What creates freedom? A revolution in the streets? Mass protest? Civil war? A change of government? The ousting of the old guard and its replacement by the new? History, more often than not, shows that hopes raised by such events are often dashed, sooner rather than later.
author: Jonathan Sacks

quote: For a war to be just three conditions are necessary - public authority, just cause, right motive.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Total war is no longer war waged by all members of one national community against all those of another. It is total... because it may well involve the whole world.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: I knew that the Hague Convention prohibited the use of poison in war. I didn't know the details of the terms of the Convention, but I did know of that prohibition.
author: Otto Hahn

quote: I believe that political correctness can be a form of linguistic fascism, and it sends shivers down the spine of my generation who went to war against fascism.
author: P. D. James

quote: I was never convinced that war was the best system to bring democracy to the country.
author: Silvio Berlusconi

quote: I saw Kuwait many times before the war. I remember it as a beautiful place, full of very nice people, and it's a tragedy to see that somebody could set out to deliberately destroy a country the way the Iraqis have.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: The war on drugs is not being won, and it continues to threaten stability and democracy not only in the Andes but throughout the Caribbean as well, where tiny police and military forces are outclassed by the sophisticated equipment in the hands of traffickers passing through the region on the way to their market in this country.
author: Elliott Abrams

quote: If you walk into the front hallway of the CIA, you will see, on your left, a statue of William 'Wild Bill' Donovan. Bill Donovan was the person who created the OSS, the Office of Strategic Services, which was America's spy agency during World War II and then kind of morphed into what's now the CIA.
author: David Ignatius

quote: I think that this is the first war in history that on the morrow the victors sued for peace and the vanquished called for unconditional surrender.
author: Abba Eban

quote: War on the other hand is such a terrible thing, that no man, especially a Christian man, has the right to assume the responsibility of starting it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: War can only be abolished through war, and in order to get rid of the gun it is necessary to take up the gun.
author: Mao Zedong

quote: I am at war... with the principal personage of traditional philosophy, that abstract subject who masquerades as everyone and anyone, but is really a male subject in disguise.
author: Pam Gems

quote: The high point of civilization is that you can hate me and I can hate you but we develop an etiquette that allows us to deal with each other because if we acted solely upon our impulse we'd probably go to war.
author: Stanley Crouch

quote: I am passionately interested in understanding how my country works. And if you want to know about this thing called the United States of America you have to know about the Civil War.
author: Ken Burns

quote: When you go to war, both sides lose totally.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: I think what the Nobel committee is doing is going beyond war and looking at what humanity can do to prevent war. Sustainable management of our natural resources will promote peace.
author: Wangari Maathai

quote: One of the things that ultimately led me to leave mathematics and go into political science was thinking I could prevent nuclear war.
author: Paul Wolfowitz

quote: One big, glaring difference I can think of between Iraq and Vietnam is the news coverage. During the Vietnam War era, you had TV coverage of the war saturating the airwaves every night, and that coverage wasn't put through a military filter at all.
author: Mark Boal

quote: I think that you can honour the sacrifices of a common soldier without glorifying war.
author: Geraldine Brooks

quote: There was a belief after World War I that painting could be an act of civil revolt. I want this exhibition, 'New Museum,' to be an act of civil disobedience. It's not so much about the New Museum on the Bowery, but the idea of challenging museums as projections of cultural authority. It's painting as insurgency.
author: Richard Phillips

quote: As history has repeatedly proven, one trade tariff begets another, then another - until you've got a full-blown trade war. No one ever wins, and consumers always get screwed.
author: Mark McKinnon

quote: In our Country... one class of men makes war and leaves another to fight it out.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: I wanted to fight in the Iraq war because I felt like I had an obligation as a human being to help free people from oppression.
author: Edward Snowden

quote: I don't know why you use a fancy French word like detente when there's a good English phrase for it - cold war.
author: Golda Meir

quote: The great leaders of the second world war alliance, Franklin Roosevelt and Winston Churchill, understood the twin sides of destruction and salvation. Their war aims were not only to defeat fascism, but to create a world of shared prosperity.
author: Jeffrey Sachs

quote: Western civilization, Christianity, decency are struggling for their very lives. In this worldwide civil war, race prejudice is our most dangerous enemy, for it is a disease at the very root of our democratic life.
author: Mordecai Wyatt Johnson

quote: While religious tolerance is surely better than religious war, tolerance is not without its liabilities. Our fear of provoking religious hatred has rendered us incapable of criticizing ideas that are now patently absurd and increasingly maladaptive.
author: Sam Harris

quote: People have to realize that dieting is not a sprint, it's a marathon. If you celebrate the small victories, you will eventually win the war.
author: Ian K. Smith

quote: We can have a World War, I see absolutely no reason why we shouldn't have a World Party.
author: Vanna Bonta

quote: The most shocking fact about war is that its victims and its instruments are individual human beings, and that these individual beings are condemned by the monstrous conventions of politics to murder or be murdered in quarrels not their own.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: War is hell.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: War makes thieves and peace hangs them.
author: George Herbert

quote: It is not only the living who are killed in war.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: The great object is that every man be armed.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: War never takes a wicked man by chance, the good man always.
author: Sophocles

quote: Sweat saves blood.
author: Erwin Rommel

quote: It has too often been too easy for rulers and governments to incite man to war.
author: Lester B. Pearson

quote: A boy doesn't have to go to war to be a hero he can say he doesn't like pie when he sees there isn't enough to go around.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: The terrorists and their supporters declared war on the United States - and war is what they got.
author: George W. Bush

quote: Allow the president to invade a neighboring nation whenever he shall deem it necessary to repel an invasion,and you allow him to do so whenever he may choose to say he deems it necessary for such purpose - and you allow him to make war at pleasure.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: War is a racket. It is the only one international in scope. It is the only one in which the profits are reckoned in dollars and the losses in lives.
author: Smedley Butler

quote: The next war... may well bury Western civilization forever.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: The question is: how bad do things have to get before you will do something about it? Where is your line in the sand? If you don't enforce the constitutional limitations on your government very soon, you are likely to find out what World War III will be like.
author: Michael Badnarik

quote: When this sad war is over we will all return to our homes, and feel that we can ask no higher honor than the proud consciousness that we belonged to the Army of the Potomac.
author: George B. McClellan

quote: Meanwhile, our young men and women whose economic circumstances make military service a viable career choice are dying bravely in a war with no end in sight.
author: Charles B. Rangel

quote: War is a poor chisel to carve out tomorrow.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Peace must be more than the absence of war.
author: Helmut Kohl

quote: In most of the European countries - France stands out in its resistance to this particular form of American cultural imperialism - the national film industries were forced onto the defensive after the war by such binding agreements.
author: Fredric Jameson

quote: The real trouble with war (modern war) is that it gives no one a chance to kill the right people.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: We want to keep the actual Civil War experience alive.

quote: If we justify war, it is because all peoples always justify the traits of which they find themselves possessed, not because war will bear an objective examination of its merits.
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: The M-1 is the best tank in the world, if you can get it to the war in time, if you have a Saddam Hussein who'll give you seven months to move your forces in.
author: Ralph Peters

quote: The guys who won World War II and that whole generation have disappeared, and now we have a bunch of teenage twits.

quote: South Korea first allowed women into the military in 1950 during the Korean War. Back then, female soldiers mainly held administrative and support positions. Women began to take on combat roles in the 1990s when the three military academies, exclusive to men, began accepting women.
author: Kim Young-ha

quote: What 'War and Peace' is to the novel and 'Hamlet' is to the theater, Swan Lake' is to ballet - that is, the name which to many people stands for and sums up an art form.
author: Robert Gottlieb

author: Uzo Aduba

author: Menachem Begin

quote: The story of FDR as U.S. Commander in Chief is a heroic war story of a president who had already overcome great adversity in facing polio but who went on to take the reins of our armed forces in the greatest conflagration in human history - on our behalf.
author: Nigel Hamilton

quote: Science fiction has always been a means for political comment. H.G. Wells' 'The War of the Worlds' wasn't about a Martian invasion - it was a critique of British colonialism, and... 'The Time Machine' is really an indictment of the British class system.
author: Robert J. Sawyer

author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: During war, the laws are silent.
author: Quintus Tullius Cicero

author: Ronald Reagan

quote: The most persistent sound which reverberates through man's history is the beating of war drums.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: There is hardly such a thing as a war in which it makes no difference who wins. Nearly always one side stands more or less for progress, the other side more or less for reaction.
author: George Orwell

quote: War is wretched beyond description, and only a fool or a fraud could sentimentalize its cruel reality.
author: John McCain

quote: War settles nothing.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: A man who says that no patriot should attack the war until it is over... is saying no good son should warn his mother of a cliff until she has fallen.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: I have many times asked myself whether there can be more potent advocates of peace upon earth through the years to come than this massed multitude of silent witnesses to the desolation of war.
author: King George V

author: Ted Nugent

author: Georg Solti

author: Eric Shinseki

quote: It required a strong heart to stand up against such talk, but I urged my people to be quiet and not to begin a war.
author: Chief Joseph

author: Arrian

author: Samuel E. Morison

quote: The Korean war has always been an unpopular war among the American people.
author: Paul Robeson

quote: The young patriots now returning from war in Iraq and Afghanistan and other deployments worldwide are joining the ranks of veterans to whom America owes an immense debt of gratitude.

quote: The definition of a modern approach to war is the acknowledgement of individual lives lost.
author: Maya Lin

quote: We were succeeding. When you looked at specifics, this became a war of attrition. We were winning.
author: William Westmoreland

quote: I am not protesting against the conduct of the war, but against the political errors and insincerities for which the fighting men are being sacrificed.
author: Siegfried Sassoon

author: Marsha Blackburn

quote: There are patriots who opposed the war in Iraq and there are patriots who supported the war in Iraq. We are one people, all of us pledging allegiance to the stars and stripes, all of us defending the United States of America.
author: Barack Obama

quote: War, except in self-defense, is a failure of moral imagination.
author: Bill Moyers

quote: Guerrilla war is a kind of war waged by the few but dependent on the support of many.
author: B. H. Liddell Hart

quote: We can only move to a long-term resolution regarding terrorism and war by planting seeds of peace. We have to start with ourselves.
author: Peter Yarrow

quote: War is not merely a political act but a real political instrument, a continuation of political intercourse, a carrying out of the same by other means.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

author: Imelda Staunton

quote: There aren't a lot of guys like me left. But I'm a war horse. I've been through it all. And you know something about war horses? Through the sleet, through the snow, they just keep going.
author: Joel Silver

quote: America stood at the summit of power, emerging from the Cold War as an economic, cultural and military force without equal.
author: Lincoln Chafee

quote: It's never acceptable to target civilians. It violates the Geneva Accords, it violates the international law of war and it violates all principles of morality.
author: Alan Dershowitz

quote: Remember, God provides the best camouflage several hours out of every 24.
author: David M. Shoup

quote: I do not believe that the men who served in uniform in Vietnam have been given the credit they deserve. It was a difficult war against an unorthodox enemy.
author: William Westmoreland

quote: War is much too serious a thing to be left to military men.

author: James A. Garfield

quote: I tell people I won't vote to go to war unless I'm ready to go or send my kids.
author: Rand Paul

quote: World War II had a very important impact on the development of technology, as a whole.

author: Morrissey

author: Yves Behar

quote: War is the unfolding of miscalculations.
author: Barbara Tuchman

quote: Can anything be stupider than that a man has the right to kill me because he lives on the other side of a river and his ruler has a quarrel with mine, though I have not quarrelled with him?
author: Blaise Pascal

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: War is fear cloaked in courage.

quote: No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: Everyone, when there's war in the air, learns to live in a new element: falsehood.

quote: One may know how to gain a victory, and know not how to use it.

quote: You can't say civilization don't advance... in every war they kill you in a new way.

quote: We have been travelling through a cloud. The sky has been dark ever since the war began.
author: Black Kettle

quote: War is cruelty, and none can make it gentle.

quote: The Japanese scored an important victory at Pearl Harbor, but the attack pulled the United States into World War II, and four years later, Japan was in ruins, utterly defeated.
author: Peter L. Bergen

author: Red Auerbach

quote: Let the word go forth from this time and place, to friend and foe alike, that the torch has been passed to a new generation of Americans - born in this century, tempered by war, disciplined by a hard and bitter peace.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The basic fact about human existence is not that it is a tragedy, but that it is a bore. It is not so much a war as an endless standing in line.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: This administration here and now declares unconditional war on poverty.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: In war there is no prize for runner-up.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: In war, when a commander becomes so bereft of reason and perspective that he fails to understand the dependence of arms on Divine guidance, he no longer deserves victory.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: War is delightful to those who have had no experience of it.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: A war for a great principle ennobles a nation.
author: Albert Pike

quote: Being over seventy is like being engaged in a war. All our friends are going or gone and we survive amongst the dead and the dying as on a battlefield.
author: St. Jerome

quote: I am never going to have anything more to do with politics or politicians. When this war is over I shall confine myself entirely to writing and painting.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: War is like love it always finds a way.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: There must be people who remember World War II and the Holocaust who can help us get out of this rut.

author: B. H. Liddell Hart

quote: We shall never be able to remove suspicion and fear as potential causes of war until communication is permitted to flow, free and open, across international boundaries.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: To establish any mode to abolish war, however advantageous it might be to Nations, would be to take from such Government the most lucrative of its branches.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: I'm tired. I'm tired of feeling rejected by the American people. I'm tired of waking up in the middle of the night worrying about the war.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: The Canadian government continues to say they will not help us if we go to war with Iraq. However, the prime minister of Canada said he'd like to help, but he's pretty sure that last time he checked, Canada had no army.
author: Conan O'Brien

quote: We've killed a million Iraqis since the start of the Gulf war - mostly by blocking humanitarian aid.
author: Woody Harrelson

quote: There are no absolute rules of conduct, either in peace or war. Everything depends on circumstances.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: War is not the continuation of politics with different means, it is the greatest mass-crime perpetrated on the community of man.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: The time not to become a father is eighteen years before a war.

quote: I just want you to know that, when we talk about war, we're really talking about peace.
author: George W. Bush

quote: One certain effect of war is to diminish freedom of expression.
author: Howard Zinn

quote: Unconditional war can no longer lead to unconditional victory. It can no longer serve to settle disputes... can no longer be of concern to great powers alone.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: What is more immoral than war?
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: Either war is obsolete, or men are.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

quote: I asked a Burmese why women, after centuries of following their men, now walk ahead. He said there were many unexploded land mines since the war.
author: Robert Mueller

quote: I want a world without war, a world without insanity. I want to see people do well. I don't even think it's as much as what I want for myself. It's more what I want for the people around me. That's what I want.

quote: I do not believe, given her past decisions and comments on the reasons to go to war in Iraq, that Dr. Rice will be able to represent the United States without a predetermined bias from the war.
author: Daniel Akaka

quote: There is no glory in war, yet from the blackness of its history, there emerge vivid colours of human character and courage. Those who risked their lives to help their friends.
author: Silvia Cartwright

quote: Unless and until something concrete is done about addressing the Israeli-Palestinian issue you won't get a real start on the war against terrorism.
author: Bob Hawke

author: Anthony Zinni

quote: War is one of the scourges with which it has pleased God to afflict men.
author: Cardinal Richelieu

quote: Let him who desires peace prepare for war.
author: Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus

quote: Well, as a general remark, I would say that I was discouraged by the physical and economic conditions in continental Europe after the war.
